TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ContentInfo extends System.Object

Docs.summary: The ContentInfo class represents the CMS/PKCS #7 ContentInfo data structure as defined in the CMS/PKCS #7 standards document. This data structure is the basis for all CMS/PKCS #7 messages.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(unsigned int8[] content) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of byte values that represents the data from which to create the object.
Docs.summary: The ContentInfo constructor creates an instance of the class by using an array of byte values as the data and a default (OID) that represents the content type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo> class has the following default property values.
|Property|Default value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Security.Cryptography.Pkcs.ContentInfo.ContentType%2A>|1.2.840.113549.1.7.1 (data)|

Docs.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Security.Cryptography.Oid contentType, unsigned int8[] content) cil managed

Docs.param: An object that contains an `object identifier` (OID) that specifies the content type of the content. This can be data, digestedData, encryptedData, envelopedData, hashedData, signedAndEnvelopedData, or signedData. For more information, see Remarks.
An array of byte values that represents the data from which to create the object.
Docs.summary: The ContentInfo constructor creates an instance of the class by using the specified content type and an array of byte values as the data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The digestedData and encryptedData content types, which appear in the CMS/PKCS #7 standards document, are not content types that can be produced by this implementation. However these content types can be passed to this constructor.
Use the following OID strings as arguments to the ContentInfo constructor to build the `contentType` content type parameter.
|`contentType` content type|OID string| |--------------------------------|----------------| |data|1.2.840.113549.1.7.1| |digestedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.5| |encryptedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.6| |envelopedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.3| |hashedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.5| |signedAndEnvelopedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.4| |signedData|1.2.840.113549.1.7.2|

Docs.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.

Docs.summary: The Content property retrieves the content of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
Docs.value: An array of byte values that represents the content data.

Docs.summary: The ContentType property retrieves the object that contains the (OID) of the content type of the inner content of the CMS/PKCS #7 message.
Docs.value: An object that contains the OID value that represents the content type.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Finalize() cil managed

Docs.summary: Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the instance is reclaimed by garbage collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Security.Cryptography.Oid GetContentType(unsigned int8[] encodedMessage) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of byte values that represents the encoded message from which to retrieve the outer content type.
Docs.summary: The GetContentType static method retrieves the outer content type of the encoded message represented by an array of byte values.
Docs.returns:
If the method succeeds, the method returns an object that contains the outer content type of the specified encoded message.
If the method fails, it throws an exception.
Docs.exception: A null reference was passed to a method that does not accept it as a valid argument.
An error occurred during a cryptographic operation.
